property.name: doc-long
property.value: Do we want to set the FQDN for the system?

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The FQDN of the system.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The java home directory to use for this installation. Used for gui mapping.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: True if we should use SAPJVM. Used for UI mapping.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The path to the jce policy archive to install into the java home directory if it is not already installed.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The windows domain name for the OS users

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Password of the sidadm user.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Password of the SAPServiceSID user.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Valid values are: SAP, STD, OBR, HCP, MDAThe loadtype chosen by the user.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Manual configuration and execution of Migration Monitor.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Database server to connect to.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Login type: WIN or SQL (doesn't metter if AllowSQLLogin is false)

property.name: doc-long
property.value: SQL login to use (if any).

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Password for the SQL login

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Used in the internal dialog: "" --> auto-dialog-selection, "someValue" --> indicates unattended mode.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The DB SID

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The DB host

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The SAP System ID of the system to install

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Human readable form of the Default Login language - used for instant in the preselection in SAPGUI. This Parameter is potentialy asked in addition in the dialog that also asks for the SID. It is not asked in all this dialogs, but only in systems that have ( potentialy beside others ) an ABAP stack. It is ask for installation but not for system copy. It is asked in those installations, that perform the ABAP load. That could be the Database Load installation in case of a distributed szenario, or in the Standard Installer, that is not distributed at all. This Parameter is saved in the Default Profile. It is has no influence on Language settings in a Java Stack. Valid names are stored in a table of the subcomponent NW_languagesInLoadChecks. The available languages must be declaired in the LANGUAGES_IN_LOAD parameter of the product.xml . In this file the one character representation of the languages is uses. Check the same table in the subcomponent mentioned above.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: The ASP device name where the SAP system will be in installed.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Output.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Default size - determines number of db files.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Internal use: overwrite the SAPinst-default behaviour to determine the required db data size. Force SAPinst to use the value [MB] specified as the expected data load.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Internal use: overwrite the SAPinst-default behaviour - do only create one db data file (value of "DbSize" (see above) will be ignored!).

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Disk drive where the data files will be created

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Disk drive Where the log files will be created

property.name: doc-long
property.value: A default RAM-size used for the configuration of min/max server memory can be assigned by a positive value

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Legal values are 'db' 'abap'

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Controls whether buildarchives are copied to the system. The parameter is overwritten by the copyBuildarchives switch in product.xml.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: 'true' if IMIG should be enabled.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: for internal use only - allows to skip UT processing components to deliver Core Engine only

property.name: doc-long
property.value: true: start the engine. false: no engine start.

property.name: doc-long
property.value: Possible values : true : start the SAP MMC. false : no SAP MMC start. This parameter makes sense only on MS Windows, since SAP MMC is availible only there.
